citation.article-title: Identification of Beijerinckia fluminensis strains CIP 106281T and UQM 1685T as Rhizobium radiobacter strains, and proposal of Beijerinckia doebereinerae sp. nov. to accommodate Beijerinckia fluminensis LMG 2819
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Beijerinckia doebereinerae sp. nov.

Beijerinckia doebereinerae (doe.be.rei′ne.rae. N.L. fem. n. doebereinerae to honour the Brazilian microbiologist Johanna Doebereiner, in recognition of her contribution to the study of nitrogen-fixing bacteria).
Cells are Gram-negative, regular, non-motile and slightly curved rods, about 3.25×1 μm, that do not form spores or zoogleas.
A large number of fimbriae are present around the cell, but no flagella are observed.
Two or more polar lipoid bodies of PHB are present per cell.
Colonies on nitrogen-free mineral agar are irregular, convex, cream in colour, opaque and highly viscous.
After 5 days of growth in nitrogen-free mineral broth, the medium becomes opaque, creamy and highly viscous.
Strictly aerobic.
Molecular nitrogen is fixed under aerobic conditions and requires molybdenum.
Temperature range for growth is 10–35 °C; no growth at 37 °C.
Grows at pH 3–10.
Optimal growth at 30 °C and pH 6.5.
No growth on peptone media.
Cytochrome oxidase and catalase tests are positive.
Reduces nitrate to nitrite.
Positive for reduction of nitrate to nitrite (API 20NE).

The remaining tests of the API 20NE kit are negative: indole production, acids from glucose, hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin, arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-galactosidase activities and assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, gluconate, caproate, adipate, malate, citrate and phenylacetate.

The following enzyme activities are recorded as positive (API ZYM): alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase.

The remaining activities in the API ZYM system are negative: α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Utilizes the following substrates (API 50 CH): l-arabinose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, maltose, sucrose, turanose, d-lyxose and d-fucose.

Does not utilize glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-mannopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, lactose, melibiose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, d-tagatose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate.
Fatty acids detected are, in decreasing order of abundance, 18 : 1ω7c, summed feature 3 (16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-15 : 0 2-OH) and 16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 57.1 mol%.
The type strain is LMG 2819T (=CECT 7311T), which was deposited by F.
Hilger at the LMG before 1966 according to the online catalogue (http://bccm.belspo.be/).
